results.title: The XPT East Coast journey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
On the Express Passenger Train- Australia’s fastest train, travel from Brisbane in subtropical Queensland to cosmopolitan Sydney in the heart of New South Wales. Cross the rugged Macpherson ranges, tour Australia’s economic heartland and visit the country’s pristine beaches. The XPT even cruises through some alternative villages and through Australia’s spectacular rainforests. As the train pulls into one of its 21 stops, Coff’s Harbour, view the vast plantations of bananas as well as the gaudy “Big Banana” tourist park, which symbolizes the recent tourism boom. Finally, the XPT reaches Sydney. Hugging the shores of a magnificent harbor and accented by its elegant bridge, Sydney is the quintessential icon of the Australian experience.

results.title: The Ghan: a spiritual connection
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
The legendary Ghan was named after the Afghans who with their camels opened the supply line through Australia’s interior. On this rich and fascinating journey from Adelaide to the Red Centre of Australia, traverse some of the world’s most ancient and inhospitable terrain, exploring the history of this great train line. At the remote town of Pimba, attend a rock concert in the middle of the Australian desert, arranged by the world music organisation WOMAD. Later, when the Ghan pulls into Alice Springs, visit Uluru, the largest free standing rock in the world. Uluru is a sacred aboriginal dreaming site that was returned to it’s original owners in 1985 and is now one of Australia’s most celebrated tourist attractions.

results.title: Woodworking machinery series
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description: Each film in this series is a complete unit in itself. The series of four films gives a basic training in the use of woodworking machinery.

group_works.title: Setting out, mortising, tenoning, band saw

results.title: Setting out, mortising, tenoning, band saw
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Woodworking machinery series”.
Shows and demonstrates the following: Job set out on rod; surfaces of members selected and marked for position of mortises; operation of mortising machine, first chisel and auger, then chain cutter; tenoning machine, explained and shown at work; cutters are shaped by grinding; the machine is set up and work carried out; the band saw is described and seen at work; the method of fitting a new saw is demonstrated; bevel cutting is shown.

results.title: Vertical spindle moulding machine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Woodworking machinery series”
Short description of machine, moulding and rabbeting stiles, rails and bar of sash. Setting the cutters, use of face board. Franking, cutting tenons to length. Other uses, the Whitehall cutter block, French or slotted head.

results.title: Planing machines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Woodworking machinery series”.
A surface planing machine is shown in use. Its principle is explained by animated diagrams. The method of sharpening cutters by machine is demonstrated.

results.title: Circular saws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Woodworking machinery series”.
The film starts with a short description of a saw bench and stresses the point that saws must be kept sharp. Machine sharpening is demonstrated, followed by hand sharpening and setting. Special types of saws, inserted tooth saw, swage saw and novelty tooth saw, are described. After sharpening, the rip saw is replaced on its spindle and packing inserted. Safety precautions saw guard, riving knife and push stick, are shown. A cross-cut saw is demonstrated. Adjustment for angle cutting, use of trenching heads for cutting housings.

group_works.title: The Jimi Hendrix Experience: electric ladyland
group_works.creator_credit: Roger Pomphrey, Bous De Jong, Nick de Grunewald, BBC, Daniel Television, Experience Hendrix and Isis Productions

results.title: The Jimi Hendrix Experience: electric ladyland
results.creator_credit: Roger Pomphrey, Bous De Jong, Nick de Grunewald, BBC, Daniel Television, Experience Hendrix and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
Jimi Hendrix’s album “Electric Ladyland” is one of the classic rock albums of the 20th century. With songs like “Voodoo Chile”, “Crosstown Traffic”, “Gypsy Eyes”, and “All Along the Watchtower”, it has influenced countless rock guitarists. This documentary, part of the “Classic Album” series, examines both the recording process of the album as well as focusing on the life and legend of Jimi Hendrix. Examining each song on the album, the documentary intersperses interviews with Hendrix’s friends and musicians who played on the album, with footage of Hendrix both playing and being interviewed, photos (including Linda McCartney’s pictures for the album cover), and Hendrix’s notes and journals as well as lots of amazing music. People interviewed include Chas Chandler, Mitch Mitchell, Noel Redding, Buddy Miles, Dave Mason, Mike Finnigan, Steve Winwood and album engineer Eddie Krammer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Pomphrey, Bous De Jong, Nick de Grunewald, BBC, Daniel Television, Experience Hendrix and Isis Productions

results.title: Stevie Wonder: songs in the key of life
results.creator_credit: David Heffernan, Bous De Jong, Daniel Television and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
Taking more than two years from conception to release, ‘Songs in the key of life’ is considered to be one of the highlights of Stevie Wonder’s career, as well as one of the classic albums of the century. Originally released in 1976, the album entered the U.S Billboard album charts at number one and held the position for 14 weeks. Success also heralded Motown Records’ reinvestment in Wonder, resigning him to the label in a lucrative deal. The album was successful in the United Kingdom, reaching number two, remaining in the charts for over a year, and was a worldwide best seller. This outstanding success in 1976 culminated in the announcement that Stevie Wonder was the recipient of Album of the Year at the Grammys, as well as being named Producer of the Year and Best Male Vocal Performer. The remarkable story behind this phenomenally successful year for Wonder is told here as he reminisces about the inspiration behind the album.
